content.description:
American Gigalo is one of the coveted Top 100. 
  
 Start matched on a sloper/pinch and move up to a good rail. A sidepull around the left side leads to a fun top out.

The American Gigolo boulder is immediately south of the landmark Black Dyke boulder. Other problems on the boulder include Left Rib and Doubt, both excellent problems in their own right.
One pad is probably sufficient, though you may want to pad the rock behind as well.

Sit start with right hand pinching the arete and your left on a sloper.  Use some body english to get to the top.  Cool problem and perfect rock!

Just south of the Black Dyke boulder.  Directly across from Squamish Days
pad

Slab behind the fried ant boulder

Behind the fried ant boulder

Start matched on good holds above the lip, heel around the right side and fire straight up on good holds.



South end of the Fried Ant boulder.

Start seated matched under a jug below the left arete.  Heel hook the arete and hit the top.  Fun! 
  
 Viper Area.  On same boulder as University Crawl.

The magical forest of the Grand Wall boulders. Doubt V5 is seen in the centre of the photo. Stand start using a great jug. Use a good side pull on the arete to reach a bad right hand crinch. Slap left then go for the rail with some combination of trickery and desperation. This a great problem. Located on the American Gigolo boulder, Doubt is between that problem and Left Rib. The American Gigolo boulder is immediately south of the landmark Black Dyke boulder. Doubt looks a little scary, but dont let that stop you. Looks can be deceiving.

You'll want a few pads for this one. Don't worry too much about falling into the hole, but you definitely want to pad the big rocks in front of the boulder quite well.

The falls are actually quite good, despite what it might look like.

Start on a low flexing undercling. Fire upwards and figure out how to use the sloping block feature to top out.

Just left of Anatomy Lesson and across from Squamish Days.
Pads

Start on good sidepull edges with feet under the boulder, shoot left into obvious crimps, bump up to the jug horn and over.



East side of the Pulling Teeth boulder. The jug horn/flake is obvious at a little over head height.

Start matched on a ledge and move up the slab.



Backside of White Bread problem.

pull on to two decent crimps, being reach to the lip

starts in a pit behind White bread (look for two chalked crimps above a funky little pit)
dab pad maybe

Start low and left on good holds.  Move up right to an amazing hold.

Viper Area.  Fried Ant boulder is just "above"ish of Squamish Days boulder.
Boulder pad(s)

Left Rib V2 Left Rib is an excellent problem in a similar style to Cheese Grater, only a little longer, a little harder, and a little better. Start with your left hand on a slanting rail and move up and right to a decent crimp. Slap right for the rib. Move up the rib with good footwork (crux) and some trickery to an easy topout. Alternately climb the rib directly from below at the same grade. Left Rib is on the same boulder as the classic V3 American Gigolo, and is just south of the Black Dyke boulder

For more beta I recommend purchasing Marc Bourdon's excellent guidebook from one of the local stores. The landing is very good for Squamish, though two pads are nice to have.

Sit start using a small rail and move up to a good right hand and then a higher side-pull. Traverse the boulder on good holds to its left arête. High step then make committing moves up the slab to the the top. 
  
 An outstanding problem that's well deserving of its top 100 status.

The Old and Serious boulder is uphill from the landmark Black Dyke boulder, just above Viper
Great landing for Squamish, though most people will want two pads and a spotter for reassurance as the slab moves are a bit scary.

start on pinch in cave climb up

in a pit between white bread and old and serious
dab pad

Start on the left side of the jug-covered face with 2 good holds and climb up and left to the arete.  A loose hold as been taken out.  I believe this may make this problem considerably easier as it as left a large positive hold in its place, anyone familliar with this please comment.

Viper area.  Just up the stairs from Pulling Teeth boulder.
Good for solo sessions.

Start as for Squamish Days but shoot straight up to the top instead of using the arête

Squamish Days boulder

Sit Down Start.  Start seated using a very low sloping shelf.  Pull up to good holds then traverse right to finish.

Viper area, same boulder as Squamish Days.
Boulder pad(s)

Sit start Squamish Days on a good low left crimp and a rattling right sidepull undercut (with a loose rock inside it), then climb up and finish as for the regular line. This is as low as it seems possible to start with the hands—lower than the shelfs—and is quite dabby.


A blubber pad helps to avoid dabbing the start. If you can do the first moves you won’t fall on any other.

Start with right dyke hold at undercut with no feet. Fire left to sloping edge in overhang, match, move left and exit onto slab

Near the Black Dyke Boulder
Crashpad, no spotter required

Climb the insecure, snakelike fin of rock up the overhinging face. Start with hands on the fin at mid-height and go for it!

SE of the Black Dyke Boulder
a couple of crashpads and good spotters

Start pinching the arete on the right with a decent nub for your foot. Move up and left to a large block feature. Mantle, then top out. Pleasant movement.

On the north face of the White Bread boulder, which is just southwest of Viper. The big juggy block in the middle of a 15ft face is the key feature.
1 pad is fine.

Essentially a variation of the start of the excellent problem Old and Serious, Young and Furious is a worthy problem in its own right. 
  
 Start standing on the left side of the boulder using an undercling and bad feet. Make a big move up and right to a good hold. Finish as for Old and Serious.

The Old and Serious boulder is uphill from the landmark Black Dyke boulder, just above Viper
Great landing for Squamish, though most people will want two pads and a spotter for reassurance as the slab moves are a bit scary.

This area encompasses the problems immediately south of the Black Dyke boulder, and is typically accessed by following the first Psych Ledge trail to the Black Dyke boulder, then heading south. Alternatively this area can be reached by continuing along the trail north from the Thighmaster area. 
  
 There are an incredible number of excellent problems in this popular area.
